title: Introduction to MedDataSets
text: MedDataSets package provides extensive collection datasets related medicine, diseases, treatments, drugs, public health. covers topics pharmacokinetics, drug effectiveness, vaccine trials, survival rates, infectious disease outbreaks, medical treatments. package valuable resource researchers, analysts, healthcare professionals interested performing -depth analyses medical public health data R. datasets include information various health conditions like AIDS, cancer, bacterial infections, COVID-19, data pharmaceuticals vaccines.datasets included MedDataSets package sourced R ecosystem R packages, content modified way.

title: Introduction to MedDataSets
text: help identify type structure dataset, suffix added end dataset name. suffixes indicate format type dataset, : df: standard data frame tbl_df: tibble data frame matrix: matrix object ts: time series object makes easier work different datasets quickly identifying structure. example: ToothGrowth_df: Effect Vitamin C Tooth Growth Guinea Pigs. transplant_tbl_df: Heart Transplant Data. VADeaths_matrix: Death Rates Virginia (1940). mdeaths_ts: Monthly Deaths Lung Diseases UK.

title: Introduction to MedDataSets
text: demonstrate use datasets MedDataSets, ’ll create visualizations using ggplot2 package.

title: Introduction to MedDataSets
code: # Example: Visualizing tooth growth data ggplot(ToothGrowth_df, aes(x = dose, y = len, color = supp)) +   geom_point(size = 3, alpha = 0.7) +   labs(title = "Tooth Growth by Supplement Type and Dose",        x = "Dose",        y = "Tooth Length",        color = "Supplement Type") +   theme_minimal()

title: Introduction to MedDataSets
code: ggplot(transplant_tbl_df, aes(x = outcome)) +   geom_bar(fill = "steelblue", alpha = 0.8) +   labs(title = "Transplant Outcomes",        x = "Outcome",        y = "Count") +   theme_minimal()

what: Visualization of mdeaths - Monthly Deaths from Lung Diseases in the UK
title: Introduction to MedDataSets
code: # Crear un gráfico de serie de tiempo utilizando ggplot2 # Convertir 'mdeaths_ts' en un data frame mdeaths_df <- data.frame(   month = time(mdeaths_ts),  # Extrae las fechas de la serie de tiempo   deaths = as.numeric(mdeaths_ts)  # Convierte la serie de tiempo a numérico )  # Crear gráfico ggplot(mdeaths_df, aes(x = month, y = deaths)) +   geom_line(color = "blue", size = 1) +   labs(title = "Muertes Masculinas Respiratorias Mensuales (1974-1980)",        x = "Mes",        y = "Número de Muertes") +   theme_minimal() +   scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(1974, 1980, by = 1),                       labels = seq(1974, 1980, by = 1)) +   geom_point(color = "red", size = 1.5, alpha = 0.5)  # Añadir puntos para cada mes

title: Introduction to MedDataSets
text: MedDataSets package provides wealth datasets essential analyzing various medical health-related topics. using suffixes identify dataset types leveraging ggplot2 visualizations, users can easily explore data extract meaningful insights. details available datasets, please refer package documentation.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Renzo Caceres Rossi. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Rossi RC (2024). MedDataSets: Comprehensive Medical, Disease, Treatment, Drug Datasets R. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/lightbluetitan/meddatasets.
code: @Manual{,   title = {MedDataSets: Comprehensive Medical, Disease, Treatment, and Drug Datasets for R},   author = {Renzo Caceres Rossi},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/lightbluetitan/meddatasets}, }
